For the sketch, create a new face and draw the following: - Loop 1: Draw a circle with a center at (0.375, 0.375) and radius 0.375 - Loop 2: Draw a circle with a center at (0.1046, 0.375) and radius 0.0631 - Loop 3: Draw a circle with a center at (0.6454, 0.375) and radius 0.0631 Extrude the sketch by 0.0216 units towards the normal and apply a scale of 0.75 to the sketch. This will create a new solid body. **Part 2: CAD Model of a Circular Object with a Central Hole, Featuring a Series of Concentric Circles and a Flat Base** Create a new coordinate system at the origin with the following translation vector: (0, 0, 0.0216). For the sketch, create a new face and draw the following: - Loop 1: Draw a circle with a center at (0.375, 0.375) and radius 0.375 - Loop 2: Draw an arc with a start point at (0.0456, 0.2953), mid point at (0.375, 0.0361), and end point at (0.7044, 0.2953) - Loop 2: Draw an arc with a start point at (0.7044, 0.2953), mid point at (0.5463, 0.375), and end point at (0.7044, 0.4547) - Loop 2: Draw an arc with a start point at (0.7044, 0.4547), mid point at (0.375, 0.7139), and end point at (0.0456, 0.4547) - Loop 2: Draw an arc with a start point at (0.0456, 0.4547), mid point at (0.2037, 0.375), and end point at (0.0456, 0.2953) - Loop 4: Draw a circle with a center at (0.6454, 0.375) and radius 0.0631 Extrude the sketch by 0.0541 units towards the normal. This will join the new solid body with the existing solid body from Part 1. The final shape will be a cylindrical object with two holes on opposite sides, featuring a series of concentric circles and a flat top. The height, width, and length of each of the intermediate parts and the final shape are provided in the JSON data.</description>
